sentences.sentence: The frog( 青蛙 ) knocked a second time, and cried,
“Princess( 公主 )! Young princess!
Open the door for me!
Do you not know what you said to me
Yesterday by the cool waters of the well?
Princess! Youngest princess!
Open the door for me!”
Then said the King, “You made a promise: now you must keep it. Go and let him in.”
She went and opened the door, and the frog hopped( 蹦跳 ) in and followed her, step by step, to her chair.
Then he said, “Lift me up beside you.” She delayed( 磨蹭 ), until at last the King ordered her to do it.

Once the frog was sitting on the chair, he wanted to be on the table, and when he was on the table he said, “Now, push your little golden plate( 盘子 ) nearer to me so that we may eat from it together.”
She did this, but it was easy to see that she did not do it willingly.
The frog enjoyed what he ate, but almost every mouthful she took seemed to stick in her throat( 喉咙 ).
Finally, he said, “I have eaten and am satisfied. Now I am tired. Carry me into your little room and make your little bed ready, and we will both lie down and go to sleep.”
The King’s daughter began to cry, for she was afraid of the cold frog which she did not like to touch.
She did not want to share her pretty, clean little bed with it.
But the King grew angry and said, “He helped you when you were in trouble: you cannot reject( 拒绝 ) him now.”
So she took hold of the frog with two fingers, carried him up the stairs( 楼梯 ), and put him in a corner.
But when she was in bed he crept( 爬行 ) up to the side of the bed and said, “I am tired, take me into bed with you, or I will tell your father.”
Then she was terribly angry, and picked him up and threw him with all her strength against the wall.
“Now, you will be quiet, you horrible( 讨厌的 ) frog,” said she.
But when he fell down he was no longer a frog, but a prince( 王子 ) with beautiful kind eyes.
And later they got married, with the King’s consent( 同意 ).
The prince told her how he had been bewitched( 中魔法于 ) by a wicked( 邪恶的 ) witch( 女巫 ), and how no one but her could have freed him, and that the next day they would go together into his kingdom.
Then they went to sleep, and next morning when the sun woke them up, a carriage came driving up with eight white horses.
The horses had white ostrich( 鸵鸟 ) feathers( 羽毛 ) on their heads, and were harnessed( 被套上挽具 ) with golden chains( 链子 ).
Behind the carriage stood the Prince’s servant Faithful( 忠诚的 ) Henry.

Faithful Henry had been so unhappy when his master( 主人 ) was changed into a frog, that he had caused three iron bands( 箍 ) to be placed round his heart, to prevent( 防止 ) it from bursting( 迸裂 ) with sadness.
The carriage was to take the Prince back to his kingdom.
Faithful Henry helped them both in, and walked behind the carriage again, full of joy( 喜悦 ) because the Prince had been saved.
And when they had driven a part of the way the Prince heard a cracking( 爆裂声 ) behind him as if something had broken.
So he turned round and cried, “Henry, the carriage is breaking.”
“No, master, it is not the carriage. It is a band from my heart, which was put there in my great pain when you were a frog and imprisoned( 被囚禁 ) in the well.”
Again and once again while they were on their way something cracked( 发出爆裂声 ), and each time the Prince thought the carriage was breaking.
But it was only the bands which were breaking off the heart of Faithful Henry because his master was set free and was happy.

article_info.previous: 国王有三个女儿，其中小公主最美丽耀眼，甚至太阳都为之失色。一天小公主坐在井边玩耍，不小心把最心爱的玩具掉到了井里。孤立无援之际，一只青蛙来到她面前提出帮忙，只要公主应允让他做她的玩伴。青蛙把球捞了上来，公主却失信了。
article_info.share_words: Then said the King, “You made a promise: now you must keep it. Go and let him in.”

question.cn: 以下那个说法是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements was true?

options.cn: 国王是一个信守诺言的人。
options.en: The king was a man of his word.

options.cn: 国王是一个仗势欺人者。

analysis: 由原文可知，国王教育公主要重信守诺，并且命令公主把青蛙带进来，因此国王本人也是个信守诺言的人，答案选A。

question.cn: 王子为什么变成了青蛙？
question.en: Why did the prince become a frog？

options.en: Because he was punished by God.
Because he was framed by his servant.

options.cn: 因为他被女巫施了魔法。
options.en: Because he was bewitched by a witch.

analysis: 文中提到：“The prince told her how he had been bewitched by a wicked witch, and how no one but her could have freed him, and that the next day they would go together into his kingdom.”因此答案选C。

question.en: Where did the cracking noise come from?

options.en: It was from Faithful Henry’s heart.
It was from the horse’s heart.

analysis: 文中提到：“'No, master, it is not the carriage. It is a band from my heart, which was put there in my great pain when you were a frog and imprisoned in the well.’”因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第79天
